text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hi I'm Cladio a cloud support engineer
here at the WS office in Sydney today
I'm going to show you how to retrieve
your Windows administrator password
after you launch an Amazon EC2 instance
let's get
started first you must have a keeper to
retrieve your password if you don't have
a keeper or you have lost your keeper
then see the knowledge center article
linked in the video description for more
information now let me show you how to
get your administrator password you can
use either the Amazon EC2 console or the
AWS command line
interface i'll start by showing you how
to get your password through the console
open the AWS management console and then
navigate to the Amazon EC2
console then choose
instances next to retrieve the
administrator password of your instance
you can either right click on the
instance or choose the action menu then
security and then choose get Windows
password choose upload private key file
select the keeper or add the content of
the keeper file into the text box and
then choose the cry
password as you can see you have now the
Windows administrator
password now I'll show you how to use
the AWS CLI to get the administrator
password first make sure that you
install the AW CLI on your computer for
information on how to install or update
the AW CLI see the link in the video
description get the instance ID from the
EC2
console then run the get password data
command in the WS CLI finally press
enter you can find the password in the
commands output
note when using the AWS CLI ensure that
the user account you are utilizing has
permission to access that get password
data API
call so now you know how to retrieve
your Windows administrator password
after you launch an EC2
instance thanks for watching an EP cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
